remarks.para: The control allows the user to select a date using a visual display. You can limit the date and times that can be selected by setting the and properties.
You can change the look of the calendar portion of the control by setting the , , , , , and properties.

block.para: The control only supports Gregorian calendars.
The control only supports Gregorian calendars.

remarks.para: The control is drawn by the operating system, so the event is never raised. If you need to provide a customized look to the control, you should override the method, call the base implementation of , and then perform custom painting.
If you need custom date formatting and a selection limited to just one date, you might consider using a control instead of a . Using the eliminates much of the need for validating date/time values.
For more information on month calendar controls, see Month Calendar Control Reference.

summary.para: Represents a Windows control that enables the user to select a date using a visual monthly calendar display.

remarks.para: The constructor creates a new .
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the class.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: You must call the method afterward to update the display.
To add multiple dates in a single assignment, you can assign an array of objects to the property.

summary.para: Adds a day that is displayed in bold on an annual basis in the month calendar.

Docs.param: The date to be displayed in bold.

remarks.para: You must call the method afterward to update the display.
To add multiple dates in a single assignment, you can assign an array of objects to the property.

summary.para: Adds a day to be displayed in bold in the month calendar.

Docs.param: The date to be displayed in bold.

remarks.para: You must call the method afterward to update the display.
To add multiple dates in a single assignment, you can assign an array of objects to the property.

summary.para: Adds a day that is displayed in bold on a monthly basis in the month calendar.

Docs.param: The date to be displayed in bold.

remarks.para: Using this property, you can assign an array of annual bold dates. When you assign an array of dates, the existing dates are first cleared.

summary.para: Gets or sets the array of objects that determines which annual days are displayed in bold.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Drawing.Color BackColor { set; get; }

remarks.para: The property does not support transparent colors unless the SupportsTransparentBackColor value of is set to true.

The property is an ambient property. An ambient property is a control property that, if not set, is retrieved from the parent control. For example, a will have the same as its parent by default. For more information about ambient properties, see the class or the class overview.

Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar. For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect. This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme. If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application. Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application. To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the Enable XP visual styles check box. To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out Application.EnableVisualStyles();. For more information about visual styles, see How to: Enable Windows XP Visual Styles.

summary.para: Gets or sets the background color for the control.

Occurs when the value of the property changes.

remarks.para: This property is not relevant for this class.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating the layout for the .
Occurs when the property changes.

remarks.para: Using this property, you can assign an array of bold dates. When you assign an array of dates, the existing dates are first cleared.

summary.para: Gets or sets the array of objects that determines which nonrecurring dates are displayed in bold.

remarks.para: Only one calendar year is displayed at a time, and the maximum number of months that can be displayed is 12. Valid combinations of columns and rows make a maximum product of 12; for values greater than 12, the display is modified on a best-fit basis.

summary.para: Gets or sets the number of columns and rows of months displayed.

remarks.para: The control sets the bit flag to false, so the will not raise the event.

summary.para: Occurs when the user clicks the control.
Overrides the method.

remarks.para: The property is called when a window is created. Inheriting classes can override this property to add extra functionality, but you should first call base.getCreateParams() to make sure the control continues to work correctly.

summary.para: Gets a for creating a control.

remarks.para: The event occurs during any date selection, whether by mouse, keyboard, or code. The event is similar, but it occurs only at the end of a date selection made using the mouse.
For more information about handling events, see Consuming Events.

summary.para: Occurs when the date selected in the changes.

remarks.para: This event is similar to the event, but it occurs at the end of a date selection made using the mouse. The event occurs during any date selection, whether by mouse, keyboard, or code.
For more information about handling events, see Consuming Events.

summary.para: Occurs when the user makes an explicit date selection using the mouse.
Gets a value indicating the input method editor for the .

remarks.para: The property includes the area necessary to display the "Today:" date at the bottom of the calendar.

remarks.para: This method is called by the public Dispose() method and the method. Dispose() invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with the parameter set to true. invokes Dispose with set to false.
When the parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. This method invokes the Dispose() method of each referenced object.

summary.para: Releases all resources used by the .

remarks.para: The property is an ambient property. An ambient property is a control property that, if not set, is retrieved from the parent control. For example, a will have the same as its parent by default. For more information about ambient properties, see the class or the class overview.

Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar. For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect. This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme. If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application. Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application. To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the Enable XP visual styles check box. To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out Application.EnableVisualStyles();. For more information about visual styles, see How to: Enable Windows XP Visual Styles.

summary.para: Gets or sets the foreground color of the control.

remarks.para: The method returns a that contains the begin and end dates displayed in the current view of the control. You can modify the returned range based on the value you specify for the parameter. By specifying false, you can retrieve all dates displayed on the control; specifying true retrieves only those dates that are part of fully displayed months.

summary.para: Retrieves date information that represents the low and high limits of the displayed dates of the control.

returns.para: The begin and end dates of the displayed calendar.

Docs.param: true to retrieve only the dates that are fully contained in displayed months; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Gets or sets the maximum allowable date.

remarks.para: Setting this property does not effect the current selection range.

It is important to remember that the property represents the number of days in the selection, not the difference between and . For example, if is 7 (the default), and can be no more than six days apart.

summary.para: Gets or sets the maximum number of days that can be selected in a month calendar control.
Gets or sets the minimum allowable date.

remarks.para: This method clears all dates from the array. To remove a single date from the bold dates, use the method.
You must call the method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

summary.para: Removes all the annually bold dates.

remarks.para: This method clears the array. To remove a single date from the bold dates, use the method.
You must call the method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

summary.para: Removes all the nonrecurring bold dates.

remarks.para: This method clears the array. To remove a single date from the bold dates, use the method.
You must call the method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

summary.para: Removes all the monthly bold dates.

remarks.para: If the specified date occurs more than once in the date list, only the first date is removed. When comparing dates, only the day and month are used. You must call the method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

summary.para: Removes the specified date from the list of annually bold dates.

Docs.param: The date to remove from the date list.

remarks.para: If the specified date occurs more than once in the date list, only the first date is removed. You must call the method to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

summary.para: Removes the specified date from the list of nonrecurring bold dates.

Docs.param: The date to remove from the date list.

remarks.para: If the specified date occurs more than once in the date list, only the first date is removed. When comparing dates, only the day and month are used. You must call to ensure that the display is updated to reflect the removal.

summary.para: Removes the specified date from the list of monthly bolded dates.

Docs.param: The date to remove from the date list.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool RightToLeftLayout { set; get; }

remarks.para: The property is useful for international applications where the language is written from right to left. When the and properties are both true,
Mirroring will be turned on for the form, and control placement and text will be from right to left.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control is laid out from right to left.

remarks.para: For more information about handling events, see Consuming Events.

summary.para: Occurs when the value of the property changes.

remarks.para: The scroll rate is the number of months that the control moves its display when the user clicks a scroll arrow. If this value is 0, the number of months is reset to the default, which is the number of months displayed in the control. The maximum value is 20,000.

summary.para: Gets or sets the scroll rate for a month calendar control.

remarks.para: If you set the value of the property to a date that is earlier than the current value of the property, is automatically set equal to .
If you set a date in that causes the selection to exceed the number of days specified by the property, the value of is adjusted; is automatically set so that the number of days selected is equal to .

block.para: represents the number of days in the selection, not the difference between and . For example, if is 7 (the default), then and can be no more than six days apart.
Setting the for a control that has visual styles enabled will result in the selection range not painting correctly on the control.

summary.para: Gets or sets the end date of the selected range of dates.

remarks.para: Setting this property is functionally equivalent to using the method. You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either the or properties. You cannot change the start and end dates by setting the or property values of the property. You should use , , or .
If the property value of the is greater than its property value, the dates are swapped; the property value becomes the starting date, and property value becomes the end date.

block.para: Scrolling through the calendar display with the navigation buttons when a range is selected can cause unexpected results (for example, the date range is not preserved). If you have a single month displayed with a range of 04/01/2001 to 04/10/2001, scrolling the calendar to March changes the selected range as follows: 03/01/2001 to 03/10/2001. If you have multiple months displayed, such as March and April with a selected range of 04/01/2001 to 04/10/2001, scrolling the calendar back to January and February changes the selected range as follows: 01/01/2001 to 01/10/2001.
Setting the for a control that has visual styles enabled will result in the selection range not painting correctly on the control.

summary.para: Gets or sets the selected range of dates for a month calendar control.

remarks.para: If you set the value of the property to a date that is later than the current value of the property, is automatically set equal to .
If you set a date in that causes the selection to exceed the number of days specified by the property, the value of is adjusted; is automatically set so that the number of days selected is equal to .

block.para: represents the number of days in the selection, not the difference between and . For example, if is 7 (the default), then and can be no more than six days apart.
Setting the for a control that has visual styles enabled will result in the selection range not painting correctly on the control.

summary.para: Gets or sets the start date of the selected range of dates.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetCalendarDimensions (int x, int y);

remarks.para: The maximum number of months that you can display is 12, restricted to one calendar year. The product of the and parameters should be 12 or less. For values of and that have a product of more than 12, the greater of the and values will be iteratively reduced until the product is 12 or less.

summary.para: Sets the number of columns and rows of months to display.

Docs.param: The number of columns.
The number of rows.

remarks.para: This method sets the and the properties to the specified date. This method is the functional equivalent of setting the selection range to a single day through the method or the property.

summary.para: Sets a date as the currently selected date.

Docs.param: The date to be selected.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetSelectionRange (DateTime date1, DateTime date2);

remarks.para: Using this method is functionally equivalent to setting the property. You can set the start and end dates separately by setting either the or property.
If you set the parameter greater than the parameter, both dates are set to the value.

block.para: Scrolling through the calendar display with the navigation buttons when a range is selected can cause unexpected results (for example, the date range is not preserved). If you have a single month displayed with a range of 04/01/2001 to 04/10/2001, scrolling the calendar back changes the selected range as follows: 03/01/2001 to 03/10/2001. If you have multiple months displayed, such as March and April with a selected range of 04/01/2001 to 04/10/2001, scrolling the calendar back to January and February changes the selected range as follows: 01/01/2001 to 01/10/2001.
Setting the for a control that has visual styles enabled will result in the selection range not painting correctly on the control.

summary.para: Sets the selected dates in a month calendar control to the specified date range.

Docs.param: The beginning date of the selection range.
The end date of the selection range.

remarks.para: The date is displayed in the format specified by the system settings for the short date format.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the date represented by the property is displayed at the bottom of the control.

remarks.para: If is true, and visual styles are enabled and supported on the computer running the application, today's date will be enclosed in a square, otherwise today's date will be circled.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether today's date is identified with a circle or a square.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the month calendar control displays week numbers (1-52) to the left of each row of days.

remarks.para: The size information is presented in the form of the and members, representing the minimum width and height required to display one month in the control. The minimum required window size for a month calendar control depends on the currently selected font.

summary.para: Gets the minimum size to display one month of the calendar.
Gets or sets the size of the control.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Text { set; get; }

remarks.para: This property is not relevant for this class.

summary.para: Gets or sets the text to display on the .
Occurs when the value of the property changes.

remarks.para: The font color of the days-of-the-week text depends on the property. Setting the equal to the for the main display area of the calendar causes the days-of-the-week text to become unreadable.

Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar. For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect. This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme. If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application. Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application. To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the Enable XP visual styles check box. To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out Application.EnableVisualStyles();. For more information about visual styles, see How to: Enable Windows XP Visual Styles.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating the background color of the title area of the calendar.

remarks.para: Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar. For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect. This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme. If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application. Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application. To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the Enable XP visual styles check box. To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out Application.EnableVisualStyles();. For more information about visual styles, see How to: Enable Windows XP Visual Styles.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating the foreground color of the title area of the calendar.

remarks.para: By default, the property returns the current system date, and the property is false. Setting the property sets the property to true and, from that point, the value returned by the property is the one the user sets.

summary.para: Gets or sets the value that is used by as today's date.
Gets a value indicating whether the property has been explicitly set.

remarks.para: The string includes the type and the string returned by the method of the property.

summary.para: Returns a string that represents the control.

returns.para: A string that represents the current .

remarks.para: When the calendar is displayed, some dates precede and some follow the months that are fully displayed. Using the property, you can modify the color of the text for those dates.

Starting with Windows Vista and depending on the theme, setting this property might not change the appearance of the calendar. For example, if Windows is set to use the Aero theme, setting this property has no effect. This is because an updated version of the calendar is rendered with an appearance that is derived at run time from the current operating system theme. If you want to use this property and enable the earlier version of the calendar, you can disable visual styles for your application. Disabling visual styles might affect the appearance and behavior of other controls in your application. To disable visual styles in Visual Basic, open the Project Designer and uncheck the Enable XP visual styles check box. To disable visual styles in C#, open Program.cs and comment out Application.EnableVisualStyles();. For more information about visual styles, see How to: Enable Windows XP Visual Styles.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating the color of days in months that are not fully displayed in the control.

remarks.para: Use the method to reflect changes made to , , or properties, either directly by modifying elements of the array or by using the add or remove methods provided to modify the date lists.

summary.para: Repaints the bold dates to reflect the dates set in the lists of bold dates.
